hanzi-su-wiki:
診

Значения

Осматривать (больного)

Мнемоника

Диагноз, речь 言 о том, как избежать трёх зол (справа), причин болезни.

Варианты

诊
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhěn
to examine or treat medically
обследовать или лечить с медицинской точки зрения
rtega_mnemonic:
診診RS
诊诊		examine patient, diagnose, tell, report
  • man with a beard 㐱 (doctor) examining a patient and telling 言 him what's the matter
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 诊)
Pictophonetic: 㐱 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
診斷 [ zhěn duàn ]: diagnosis; to diagnose
診所 [ zhěn suǒ ]: clinic
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 㐱 [ zhěn ] bushy, black hair; variant of 鬒
heisig_chinese_memo: The doctor at my checkup was expressing words of concern about my umbrella shaped gut, and diagnosed me with umbrella gut.
heisig_constituent: check up, say, words, keitai, mouth, parasol, umbrella, shape
heisig_story: Words . . . umbrella . . . shape. The key word refers to a medical examination.
koohiiStory1: At my last check-up, the doctor said to me: "Start carrying a parasol, or you might get skin cancer. You've been tanning too much!" [Umbrella over shape = parasol].
koohiiStory2: The doctor at my checkup was expressing words of concern about my umbrella shaped gut.
jp_example_words:
診療(しんりょう): medical examination and treatment, diagnosis
聴診器(ちょうしんき): stethoscope
診察(しんさつ): medical examination
診断(しんだん): diagnosis
診る(みる): (medicine) examine
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: They say if you use a hat to cover the area your hair used to be, chances are you had a doctor diagnose you with cancer. Sometimes after you get diagnosed with cancer, the process makes you lose your hair, and you have to wear a hat. It’s sad, but true.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the doctor diagnosing you with cancer. All of your hair falls out just thinking about it. Now put on your hat.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You just had the doctor diagnose you with cancer. How terrible. You stumble out of the room, dumbfounded. Not paying attention you bang your shin (しん) on the table. Your shin really hurts. What an awful day.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hold your shin as you feel the throbbing pain in it. Even though the pain is so extreme, you can’t help but still think about the diagnosis you got from the doctor.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 珍 (めずらしい、チン редкостный).
Ru_Radicals: 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 彡 (украшение), 言 (слово)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the words (言) of the furry man (㐱) are a diagnosis
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Some people have a problem with letting inappropriate words out after too many cocktails.  Then the doctor diagnoses them with alcoholism.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " yan " and "㐱", the original meaning is censorship . "Shuowen": "See also. Congyan, 㐱 sound." Li Daoyuan of the Northern Wei Dynasty, "Shui Jing Zhu-Yangshui": "According to the scriptures: Yangshui flows out of Didao County, and east to Ju County is Han River. From the southeast to Baishui of Guangwei Dynasty. It seems to be consistent with the three theories and not the origin of the Western Han Dynasty."

" Diagnosis " can mean diagnosis and pulse waiting. "Liezi Liming": "One is the Jiao family, the second is the Yu family, and the third is the Lu family, to diagnose the disease." Yin Jingshun explained: "Diagnosing, forbearing and cutting, and waiting for the pulse."

" Diagnosis " also means symptoms. "Su Wen‧ Feng Lun": "The emperor said: What are the different shapes of the five Tibetan winds? I would like to hear about the diagnosis and the ability of the disease." Wang Bing's note: "The diagnosis is the evidence."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " yan " and "㐱", the original meaning is to look at it.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「㐱」聲，本義為省視。《說文》：「視也。从言，㐱聲。」 北魏酈道元《水經注‧漾水》：「是以經云：漾水出氐道縣，東至沮縣為漢水，東南至廣魏白水。診其沿注，似與三說相符而未極西漢之源矣。」

　　「診」可表示診斷、候脈。《列子‧力命》：「一曰矯氏，二曰俞氏，三曰盧氏，診其所疾。」殷敬順釋文：「診，之忍切，候脈也。」

　　「診」也表示症狀。《素問‧風論》：「帝曰：五藏風之形狀不同者何？願聞其診及其病能。」王冰注：「診謂可言之證。」

診療(しんりょう): medical examination and treatment, diagnosis
聴診器(ちょうしんき): stethoscope
診察(しんさつ): medical examination

從「 言 」，「 㐱 」聲，本義為省視。《說文》：「視也。从言，㐱聲。」 北魏酈道元《水經注‧漾水》：「是以經云：漾水出氐道縣，東至沮縣為漢水，東南至廣魏白水。診其沿注，似與三說相符而未極西漢之源矣。」 「 診 」可表示診斷、候脈。《列子‧力命》：「一曰矯氏，二曰俞氏，三曰盧氏，診其所疾。」殷敬順釋文：「診，之忍切，候脈也。」 「 診 」也表示症狀。《素問‧風論》：「帝曰：五藏風之形狀不同者何？願聞其診及其病能。」王冰注：「診謂可言之證。」
From the sound of " yan" and " 㐱", the original meaning is censorship. "Shuowen": "See also. Congyan, 㐱 sound." Li Daoyuan of the Northern Wei Dynasty, "Shui Jing Zhu-Yangshui": "According to the scriptures: Yangshui flows out of Didao County, and east to Ju County is Han River. From the southeast to Baishui of Guangwei Dynasty. It seems to be consistent with the three theories and not the origin of the Western Han Dynasty." " Diagnosis" can mean diagnosis and pulse waiting. "Liezi Liming": "One is the Jiao family, the second is the Yu family, and the third is the Lu family, to diagnose the disease." Yin Jingshun explained: "Diagnosing, forbearing and cutting, and waiting for the pulse." " Diagnosis" also means symptoms. "Su Wen‧ Feng Lun": "The emperor said: What are the different shapes of the five Tibetan winds? I would like to hear about the diagnosis and the ability of the disease." Wang Bing's note: "The diagnosis is the evidence."

診字的基本解释

診
zhěn
见“诊”。

診字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhěn］
［《廣韻》章忍切，上軫，章。］
［《廣韻》直刃切，去震，澄。］
“诊1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)省视；察看。
(2)候脉察病；诊断。
(3)指使诊断，就诊。
(4)症状。
(5)医治。
(6)整治。
(7)通“畛”。告诉。

診字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　診； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1152第24
【玉篇】【唐韻】之忍切【廣韻】章忍切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】止忍切，?音軫。【說文】視也。【玉篇】驗也。【後漢·王喬傳】詔上方診視。【註】診亦視也。【莊子·人閒世】匠石覺而診其夢。【註】占驗也。　又【廣韻】?脈也。【史記·倉公傳】診切其脈。【前漢·藝文志】論病以及國，原診以知政。【註】診，視驗。謂視其脈及色?也。　又【玉篇】除刃切【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】直刃切，?音陣。義同。　又叶知鄰切，軫平聲。【急就章】變鬭殺傷捕伍鄰，亭長游徼共雜診。　【集韻】或作䝩。

Diagnosis
Name meaning

zhěn
вм. 诊
Radicals: 言, 彡  (say, hair, hat)
Meaning Mnemonic
They say if you use a hat to cover the area your hair used to be, chances are you had a doctor diagnose you with cancer. Sometimes after you get diagnosed with cancer, the process makes you lose your hair, and you have to wear a hat. It’s sad, but true.
Imagine the doctor diagnosing you with cancer. All of your hair falls out just thinking about it. Now put on your hat.
Reading Mnemonic
You just had the doctor diagnose you with cancer. How terrible. You stumble out of the room, dumbfounded. Not paying attention you bang your shin (しん) on the table. Your shin really hurts. What an awful day.
Hold your shin as you feel the throbbing pain in it. Even though the pain is so extreme, you can’t help but still think about the diagnosis you got from the doctor.
